---
title: "Homework 2"
format: pdf
execute:
  error: false
  message: false
  warning: false
  echo: false
---




1.  Install the `{nlme}` package

2.  Load `{nlme}`, `{janitor}`, and the `{tidyverse}` packages in the "setup" chunk

3.  Run the chunk below to prep some data from the `{nmle}` package for plotting


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pd <- Oxboys %>% 
  clean_names() %>% 
  mutate(subject = factor(subject),
         occasion = factor(occasion)) %>% 
  filter(subject == "10" | subject == "4" | subject == "7") %>% 
  as_tibble()
```
:::


\newpage

4.  Reproduce the following two plots, using the *pd* data. You can use whatever theme you want (I used `theme_minimal()`), but all else should be the same. Note that Plot 1 is a line plot, not a "smooth." Note that Plot 2 is a line plot also.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hw2_files/figure-pdf/plots1-1.pdf)
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hw2_files/figure-pdf/plots1-2.pdf)
:::
:::


\newpage

5.  Use the *mtcars* dataset from base `R` to replicate the following plots. (Just type *mtcars* into the console to see the dataset).
